title: South Boston St. Patrick’s Parade to follow new route for 250th Evacuation Day
author: Samantha Genzer
bullets: The 2026 St. Patrick's Parade in South Boston will start at Andrew Square, not end there, to honor Henry Knox.
The new parade route commemorates the 250th Evacuation Day, marking the British withdrawal from Boston in 1776.
A 'family-friendly zone' is designated at Medal of Honor Park; parade start time remains 11:30 a.m.

title: New England has the best open-air and maritime museums in America, according to USA Today readers
author: Kristi Palma
bullets: Plimoth Patuxet Museums in Plymouth, MA, named top open-air museum by USA Today readers in 2026.
Maine Maritime Museum in Bath, ME, ranked No. 1 maritime museum in USA Today's 10Best Readers’ Choice Awards.
Old Sturbridge Village in MA and Mystic Seaport Museum in CT also featured in top open-air and maritime lists.

title: Second worker exposed to gas at Maine pulp mill dies
author: Samantha Genzer
bullets: Allen Hornberger, 26, died from gas exposure at Woodland Pulp Mill in Baileyville, Maine, nearly three weeks after the incident.
The gas exposure incident on January 27 resulted in Hornberger and intern Kasie Malcolm being overcome by a toxic concentration.
Hornberger, a North Collins native and chemical engineering graduate, worked as a process engineer at the pulp mill since 2025.

title: Warriors’ Stephen Curry to miss Thursday’s game against the Celtics
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Stephen Curry to miss Thursday's game against the Celtics due to ongoing knee pain and swelling.
Curry has not played since January 30, missing 16 games this season; the Warriors are 6-10 without him.
Krastaps Porzingis to make his Warriors debut against the Celtics after being traded from the Hawks.

title: Local obituary: Bob Aliano, worked as a Roslindale barber for 67 years
author: Boston.com Staff
bullets: Bob Aliano, longtime barber and community staple, passed away on February 14, 2026, at age 67.
Aliano worked at The Rialto Barber Shop in Roslindale since 1959, forming numerous friendships and a loyal clientele.
Funeral services scheduled at P.E. Murray – F.J. Higgins, George F. Doherty & Sons on February 22 and 23, 2026.

title: Red Sox infielder Caleb Durbin discussed how wrestling background helps with fielding
author: Hayden Bird
bullets: Caleb Durbin, acquired by the Red Sox, has a wrestling background that aids his fielding abilities.
Durbin played third base with the Brewers but may play second base for Red Sox under Alex Cora.
Durbin hit .256 with 11 home runs and 53 RBIs in 136 games for the Brewers last season.

title: 5 best new restaurant openings and dining updates in Boston (Feb. 19, 2026)
author: Katelyn Umholtz
bullets: Boston Harbor Distillery to open a new beer garden on Rose Kennedy Greenway in spring 2026.
Wulf's Fish and Savenor's Butchery to launch Boston Provisions Market at Seaport on March 2, 2026.
Monarca Taqueria's second location now open in Waltham, offering customizable burritos and tacos.

title: A Wendy’s near you may be closing soon
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: Wendy's will close 5-6% of its U.S. restaurants, about 300 stores, as part of a turnaround plan.
The closures are part of Wendy’s 'Project Fresh' to improve profitability by shutting underperforming locations.
Wendy's has over 5,600 U.S. locations, with 98 in Massachusetts, and already closed 28 stores in late 2025.

title: 6 maps predicting snowfall totals Friday into Saturday
author: John Waller
bullets: Meteorologists predict 3-6 inches of snow north of Rt. 2, including Merrimack Valley and southern New Hampshire.
Greater Boston is expected to see 1-3 inches of snow due to sleet and freezing rain mixing.
Snow bands may shift north according to updated data, affecting Friday into Saturday precipitation forecasts.

title: Where to find the best food under $20 in Waltham
author: Katelyn Umholtz and Abby Patkin
bullets: Boston Kebab offers a $15.95 kebab roll-up with complementary pita, hummus, and Turkish tea in Waltham.
Carl's Steak Subs in Waltham is popular for $16 cheesesteaks, enough for two meals, at 55 Prospect Street.
Josephs Two on Main Street serves $11.99 cranberry pancakes, with breakfast combos under $20 in Waltham.
